docs.snippet: Corporations, entrepreneurs and lawmakers are stepping up efforts to prevent sexual harassment and expand worker protections. Is it enough?

headline.print_headline: #MeToo Inspires, but Change Won’t Come Easy
headline.main: #MeToo Called for an Overhaul. Are Workplaces Really Changing?

docs.snippet: Warren Buffett’s annual letter showed that Berkshire Hathaway had substantially increased its stake in Apple. The wager has done pretty well, but will it continue to outperform?

headline.main: Will Buffett’s Bet on Apple Work Out?: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: As the country imports ever more of its fruits and vegetables, it’s time to examine the positive and negative effects on consumers and farmers.

headline.main: Most of America’s Fruit Is Now Imported. Is That a Bad Thing?

docs.snippet: Artificial intelligence video tools make it relatively easy to put one person’s face on another person’s body with few traces of manipulation. I tried it on myself. What could go wrong?

headline.print_headline: It Was Only a Matter of Time: Here Comes an App for Fake Videos
headline.main: Here Come the Fake Videos, Too

docs.snippet: Is Phillip Picardi, a former intern who now heads up Teen Vogue, the future of Condé Nast? Anna Wintour seems to think so.

headline.main: Condé Nast’s 26-Year-Old Man of the Moment

docs.snippet: Times journalists responded to some of the most common questions received from readers about our coverage of the bomber.

headline.main: ‘He Is Not a Victim’: Our Austin Bomber Coverage Explained

docs.snippet: Is Lloyd Blankfein, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, planning on stepping down “as soon as the end of the year?”

headline.main: Will Goldman’s Blankfein Depart by the End of the Year?: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: The breakout FX comedy, created by Donald Glover, returns with a grittier new season.

headline.main: The Cast of ‘Atlanta’ on Trump, Race and Fame

docs.snippet: When Michael Dell took Dell private in 2013, he had a clearly stated mission and a large stake in the company.The same can’t be said so far of Paul Jacobs in his bid for Qualcomm.

headline.main: Jacobs’s Pursuit of Qualcomm Faces Long Odds: DealBook Briefing

docs.snippet: The two discuss sexual harassment in the workplace, how to change corporate culture in meaningful and sustained ways, and whether Miss America can be relevant in the #MeToo era.

headline.main: Catharine MacKinnon and Gretchen Carlson Have a Few Things to Say
